No caso da agricultura, os problemas sгo diversos em funзгo da grande variabilidade espectral presente nas imagens devido aos diferentes tipos e condiзхes das culturas agrнcolas. Isso dificulta o desempenho dos algoritmos de classificaзгo convencionais (pixel a pixel), pois esses realizam processamento algorнtmico guiados apenas pelas variбveis estatнsticas dos dados. Uma alternativa que vem surgindo com grande potencial sгo os Sistemas Baseados no Conhecimento (Knowledge-Based Systems - KBS), visto que os mesmos empregam estratйgias de armazenamento e replicaзгo do conhecimento humano. No Brasil, esta linha de pesquisa necessita ser abordada com intensidade, tanto para a obtenзгo de sуlidos conhecimentos, como para a formaзгo de recursos humanos, em assunto de alta especificidade como sгo os algoritmos AOO. O presente trabalho propхe a investigaзгo do potencial de aplicaзхes da AOO no mapeamento agrнcola, comparando seu desempenho com o dos sistemas convencionais. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Modelagem ambiental e geotecnologias para avaliaзгo do impacto antrуpico e da sustentabilidade da substituiзгo do bioma Cerrado por agricultura intensiva no Brasil Central. (Fapesp 2009/01894-0)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Os Cerrados sгo o segundo maior bioma brasileiro e foram eleitos como uma das vinte e cinco бreas, no Planeta, consideradas mais ricas e prioritбrias para conservaзгo; contudo, este bioma vem sofrendo crescente pressгo ambiental desde a decada de 1970. A presente proposta tem como base a hipуtese de que, usando dados de sensoriamento remoto, geotecnologias e modelagem ambiental, й possнvel avaliar o impacto causado pela rбpida substituiзгo do bioma Cerrado por agricultura intensiva no Brasil Central, bem como fornecer estimativas e cenбrios sobre a sustentabilidade das atuais prбticas de uso e manejo na regiгo para horizontes temporais de 10, 20 e 30 anos futuros. Assim, pretende-se: (1) avaliar os dados MODIS (250m) quanto ao seu potencial para detectar mudanзas antrуpicas sobre a vegetaзгo dos Cerrados; (2) avaliar, por meio de imagens de sensoriamento remoto e com geotecnologias, como foi a dinвmica de substituiзгo do bioma Cerrado na regiгo de estudo, considerando cortes temporais em 1985, 1990, 1995, 2000 e 2005; (3) aplicar modelos ambientais de estimativas de perdas de solos por erosгo e de avaliaзгo de mudanзas no escoamento superficial, causadas pelas alteraзхes da cobertura vegetal; (4) desenvolver um нndice de degradaзгo ambiental (IDA) que permita avaliar os efeitos ambientais das referidas substituiзхes e prбticas de uso/manejo; (5) realizar simulaзхes e cenбrios de sustentabilidade para um horizonte temporal de 10, 20 e 30 anos futuros; e (6) realizar recomendaзхes quanto аs prбticas exploratуrias, visando a manutenзгo ou a melhoria das perspectivas de sustentabilidade para a regiгo.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Cerrado is the second Brazilian biome and was elected one of the twenty and five areas, in the Planet, considered richer and with priority for conservation; however, this biome is suffering increasing ambient pressure since the 70s. The hypothesis of this proposal is that, using remote sensing, geotecnologies and ambiental modeling, it is possible to evaluate the impact yet caused due the fast replacement of the Cerrado'natural vegetation by intensive agricultural uses in Central Brazil, as well as supplying estimates and scenarios about the sustentability of these practices in horizonts of 10, 20 and 30 years in the future. Thus, it intended: (1) to evaluate the potential of the MODIS data (250m) to detect anthropic changes on the vegetation of the Cerrado biome; (2) using remote sensing imagery and geotecnologies to evaluate the dynamics of replacement of natural vegetation by anthropic uses, considering temporal views in 1985, 1990, 2000 and 2005; (3) to apply environmental models for estimating erosion and soil losses, as well as changes in hydrologic flows caused by the alterations of the vegetal covering; (4) to develop an index of environmental degradation (IDA); (5) to construct simulation scenarios considering temporal views form 10, 20 and 30 future years; and (6) to make recommendations regarding exploratories practices, aiming the sustentability.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Environmental modelling and geotechnologies for evaluating the anthropic impact and the sustentability of the replacement of Cerrados biome by intensive agriculture in the region of Central Brazil.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Impacts of the agriculture on the Brazilian savannas biome.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The human-induced changes of the Earth s land surfaces have been unprecedented, with outcomes often indicating degradation and loss of environmental quality. Mato Grosso State in Brazil, location of the study area, underwent extensive land use and land cover changes in recent decades with the rates, patterns and consequences poorly documented until now. In this context, the aim of the present research is to propose a multidisciplinary approach for quantifying historical land use and environmental changes in the southeast part of this State, where the Cerrado biome (Brazilian savannas) has been intensively converted into agricultural lands. The methodology includes three parts: remote sensing change detection, land vulnerability mapping, and identification of key environmental indicators. Land use/cover information was extracted from a temporal remote sensing dataset using an object-oriented classification approach, and the changes quantified employing a post-classification method. In addition, the study area eill be assessed for its vulnerabilities, focusing mainly on erosion risks, use of wetlands, and use of areas with limited or no suitability for crops. Finally, key environmental indicators will be identified from the preceding steps and analyzed within the OECD Pressure-State-Response (PSR) framework.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: БREAS POTENCIAIS PRIORITБRIAS А EXPANSГO DA AGROENERGIA: MODELAGEM VIA GEOTECNOLOGIAS .
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O crescente interesse em relaзгo а agroenergia e аs atuais conjunturas energйtica, econфmica e ambiental, vem estimulando crescentes discussхes e reflexхes sobre a produзгo e o uso de biocombustнveis, como uma das principais respostas аs preocupaзхes ligadas aos problemas da atual matriz energйtica calcada fortemente em combustнveis fуsseis, alйm de convergir favoravelmente ao grave tema das mudanзas climбticas globais. Porйm, concomitantemente, a sociedade tem tambйm questionado quanto аs conseqькncias em termos de ampliaзгo das fronteiras agrнcolas sobre os remanescentes naturais e/ou dos possнveis riscos а seguranзa alimentar, surgindo entгo a importante questгo quanto а necessidade de meios efetivos e calcados em critйrios cientнficos para decisхes em relaзгo aos investimentos em energia derivada de biomassa cultivada. Neste sentido, a hipуtese da presente proposta й que ferramentas de planejamento territorial, apoiadas por geotecnologias, podem contribuir decisivamente para o levantamento e a definiзгo de бreas potenciais prioritбrias para a agroenergia, quando aplicadas numa regiгo de interesse. Em sнntese, a presente proposta leva em conta o cenбrio agrнcola jб instalado numa determinada regiгo e tambйm os zoneamentos agrнcolas oficiais existentes, procurando em seguida responder, a partir de critйrios cientнficos, аs seguintes questхes: a) existe ainda potencial para culturas energйticas nesta regiгo de interesse? b) Onde estaria este potencial? c) De quanto seria este potencial? d) Se vierem a ser efetivamente instaladas as culturas agroenergйticas nas бreas prioritбrias potenciais identificadas, o que mudaria em relaзгo ao cenбrio agrнcola jб instalado? PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The increasing interest on the agrienergy and the current concerns associated with energy sources and economic and environmental issues, has stimulated discussions on the production and the use of biofuels as a key response to preoccupations related to the problems of the current heavily based on fossil fuels energy matrix, converging towards the grave issue of climate global change. However, concomitantly, the humanity has also asked about the consequences in terms of expansion of agricultural frontiers over the remaining natural vegetation and / or the possible risks to food safety, then arising important questions related to the need for effective and based on scientific criteria means for decisions on investments in energy derived from biomass. In this sense, the hypothesis of the present proposal is related to the use of tools for territorial planning, supported by geo, that can contribute decisively to the survey and definition of priority areas for potential agrienergy, when applied in a region of interest. Thus, to summarize, this proposal takes account the scenario of a particular agricultural region and the existing official agricultural zoning also, then trying to answer the following questions: a) is there potential for energy crops in the region of interest? b) Where would be this potential? c) How much might be this potential? d) What kind of change would we expectin the already installed agricultural scenario if energy crops were effectively implemented in the identified priority potential areas for agrienergy ? It should be noted that, during the execution of this Project, the National Institute for Space Research (INPE / MCT) and EMBRAPA (MAP) will be interacting with the objective of generating contribution in the area of bioenergy, regional planning and quantitative methods (GIS, remote sensing, spatial dynamic models, geostatistics, multi-criteria analysis). PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: DINВMICA ESPECTRAL-ANGULAR DE VARIEDADES DE SOJA E RELAЗХES COM PRODUTIVIDADE A PARTIR DE DADOS OFFNADIR MODIS, ALI E HYPERION
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Diante das dificuldades de utilizaзгo das imagens do sensor Advanced Land Imager, a bordo do satйlite Earth Observing One (EO-1), devido a problemas de correзгo radiomйtrica do instrumento, houve necessidade de redefinir os objetivos originais do projeto. O escopo do projeto relaciona-se a verificar a influкncia dos efeitos direcionais sobre a determinaзгo de нndices de vegetaзгo em бreas preservadas de floresta tropical adjacentes аs de cultura de soja. De forma mais especнfica, os objetivos sгo: (1) Estudar os efeitos direcionais sobre o cбlculo de diferentes нndices de vegetaзгo e sobre as estimativas subseqьentes do Нndice de Бrea Foliar (IAF) da soja, usando dados da Coleзгo-5 do sensor MODIS/Terra em duas estaзхes de crescimento desta cultura agrнcola (2004-2005 e 2005-2006); (2) Avaliar o desempenho de diferentes tйcnicas de classificaзгo para a discriminaзгo de variedades de soja com dados Hyperion/EO-1, discutindo a influкncia da resoluзгo espectral atravйs da simulaзгo da resoluзгo espectral de diferentes sensores multiespectrais; (3) Estudar a influкncia da geometria de iluminaзгo e visada sobre a resposta de нndices de vegetaзгo (Enhanced Vegetation Index (EVI) e Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) em бreas preservadas de floresta tropical adjacentes аs de cultura de soja, usando combinadamente dados MODIS/Terra e Hyperion/EO-1.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Improved crop monitoring through combined use of SPOT-VGT and PROBA-V data sources
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: PROBA-V will not only ensure the continuity of the successful SPOT-VGT program, but will also realize some highly needed improvements, such as an improved ground sampling distance (GSD), and a more sophisticated cloud detection algorithm. Albeit highly welcome, however, both improvements also imply serious challenges for the operational analysis of medium resolution data for those users (such as JRC-MARS) heavily relying on comparisons with the long-term-average (LTA). In particular, the added value of an improved GSD can only be fully exploited if the SPOT-VGT archive (from 1998 onwards) can be made comparable of what can be extracted from PROBA-V. The project addresses this transition phase issue and proposes the use of unmixing approaches for extracting the signal coming from agricultural targets. The unmixing approach can be equally well applied to 1000 m SPOT-VGT and PROBA-V data and is constraint with a land cover map indicating the class abundances within each 1000 m mixed pixel (derived from 300 m PROBA V data). With the unmixing of the input data, it is expected to retrieve a signal at administrative level closely related to the pure agriculture signature. If successful, this will permit a more sophisticated analysis of crop growth, for example for yield and production estimates. As the SPOT-VGT archive is processed in the same way as the PROBA-V data, long term averages (LTA) of the agricultural signature can be derived, thus enabling the calculation of vegetation anomalies. This will be a major step forward compared to the current operational status of crop monitoring programs based on remote sensing data. The 300 m PROBA-V data is important in several aspects for reaching this objective. First, thanks to the 300 m resolution, the requested abundance map can be derived. Second, the 300 m ground resolution will also permit to extract an agricultural reference signal (for example from large agricultural fields, but not limited to) to which the unmixe

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Development and implementation of a satellite-based agricultural monitoring system for Brazil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main aim of this project (Science without Borders/CNPq and CAPES) is to develop, test and implement an agricultural monitoring system which is mainly based on coarse/medium resolution MODIS images. The system also will integrate high resolution Earth Observation (EO) imagery (e.g. Landsat, ASTER and CBERS), agro-statistics and meteorological data sets. The system is designed for deriving within-season yield and crop area information as well as information regarding vegetation vigor, (drought) stress, phenology and disturbances (e.g. permanent changes of land cover). Such an agricultural monitoring system adapted to Brazilian conditions is needed as global agriculture will have to double its production within the next 40 years, while minimizing environmental impacts. This transition needs to be closely monitored. Apart from a demonstrator, the project will bring benefits in achieving international exchanges and further strengthen existing partnerships with European researchers and institutions. The collaboration will invlove internationall recognized researchers having long-lasting experience in operational crop monitoring (two researchers from JRC-MARS; one researcher from Univ. Vienna; and one researcher from CIRAD). This will allow assimilating experience and knowledge acquired over many years for Brazil's benefit. The project will also help building urgently needed capacity (mainly at post-graduate and post-doctoral levels) in the area of agricultural monitoring at macro-regional/national scale, using Earth Observion data. Besides EO data, the project makes use of meteorological data, agro-statistics and other geodata. It employs a large range of modelling techniques ranging from data mining and feature selection to machine learning and time series analysis.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Classification of soybean varieties using different techniques: case study with Hyperion and sensor spectral resolution simulations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract. Next generation imaging spectrometers with higher signal-to-noise ratio and broader swath-width bring new perspectives for crop classification over large areas. Here, we used Hyperion/Earth Observing-One data collected over Brazilian soybean fields to evaluate the performance of four classification techniques (maximum likelihood - ML; spectral angle mapper - SAM; spectral information divergence - SID; support vector machine - SVM) to discriminate five soybean varieties. The spectral resolution influence on classifying them was analyzed by simulating the spectral bands of seven multispectral sensors using Hyperion data. Before classification, the Waikato environment for knowledge analysis was used for feature selection. Results showed the importance of the green, red-edge, near-infrared, and shortwave infrared to discriminate the soybean varieties. Because the soybean variety Monsoy 8411 was sensed by Hyperion in a later reproductive stage, it was more easily discriminated than the other varieties. The best classification techniques were ML and SVM with overall accuracy of 89.80% and 81.76%, respectively. The accuracy of spectral matching techniques was lower (70.84% for SAM and 72.20% for SID). When ML was applied to the simulated spectral resolution of the multispectral sensors, moderate resolution imaging spectroradiometer and enhanced thematic mapper plus presented the highest accuracy, whereas advanced very high resolution radiometer showed the lowest one.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Refinement of the Digital Elevation Model applied to erosion modeling of watersheds.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Refinement of the Digital Elevation Model applied to erosion modeling of watersheds

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Two-dimensional topographic factor (LS2d), calculated from the flow path in the cells of the digital elevation model (DEM), allows to identify areas vulnerable to erosion due to topographical features of a watershed. This paper evaluated the influence of cell spacing and the implications of DEM refinement in the calculation of LS2d factor in order to identify areas most susceptible to erosion in a watershed located in the Upper Paraguay basin. Therefore, SRTM data were interpolated to generate four MDE refined, with different grid spacing. DEM with grid spacing of 90m x 90m, 60m x 60m, 45m x 45m and 30m x 30m were used to calculate the LS2d factor using the software USLE-2D. The results indicate that DEM refinement and the consequent reduction of cell spacing leads to an increased frequency of small values of the factor LS2d thereby reducing the overall average. We conclude that the SRTM data refinement influences the identification of areas with topographic features most susceptible to water erosion. Thus, the influence of cell spacing of the DEM should be considered in erosion modeling.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo. O fator topogrбfico й empregado na Universal Soil Loss Equation (USLE) para estimar o potencial erosivo determinado pelas formas do relevo. A modelagem do fator topogrбfico requer dados altimйtricos para a extraзгo de variбveis topogrбficas empregadas na estimativa do potencial erosivo. A presente pesquisa teve o objetivo de avaliar a aplicaзгo de Modelos Digitais de Elevaзгo (MDE) gerados com base nos dados altimйtricos obtidos por Sensoriamento Remoto (SR) orbital, Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) e ASTER Global Digital Elevation Model (GDEM), para estimar o fator topogrбfico utilizado na modelagem da erosгo. Para isto, foram analisadas as diferenзas entre os MDE obtidos com base nos dados SRTM e GDEM em relaзгo aos obtidos utilizando dados cartogrбficos do Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatнstica (IBGE) com escala 1:50.000 e do Instituto Geogrбfico e Cartogrбfico (IGC) com escala 1:10.000. Buscou-se avaliar a influкncia do espaзamento da grade do MDE e os diferentes algoritmos de distribuiзгo de fluxo, Deterministic 8 (D8) e Multiple Flow Direction (MFD), empregados para a modelagem do fator topogrбfico. A anбlise de regressгo dos resultados, utilizando os MDE gerados com base nos mapas do IGC como referкncia de precisгo, permitiu verificar que os resultados obtidos a partir dos MDE derivados dos dados SRTM apresentam maior correlaзгo (r = 0,78) do que os derivados dos dados GDEM (r = 0,65) e IBGE (r = 0,65). O aumento do espaзamento da grade e a utilizaзгo do algoritmo MFD favorecem as correlaзхes entre os valores do fator topogrбfico calculados a partir dos diferentes MDE.
